item.author: tom@slicedsoftware.com
item.description:
PGnJ is again free and it will stay that way.
Changes in 1.1

Additions:
  • The registration system has been removed. PGnJ is again free and will remain that way.
  • QuickJoin has been added to the DataBrowser (double click a table) - Easily select any fields from a joined table and they will magically appear alongside their foreign key field in the data browser (PostgreSQL and MySQL supported).
  • Use the data browser to edit records directory, just double click to edit a field (PostgreSQL and MySQL supported).

Fixes:
  • Fixes an issue with OS X Java Update 4 (the application must be run in 32 bit mode)

item.author: tom@slicedsoftware.com
item.description:
This update brings over 40 new features and enhancements to PGnJ. Check out PGnJ 1.0 for free for 15 days! Mac OS X 10.4 or 10.5 required.
Changes in 1.0

Additions:
  • Oracle support added. (Thanks, Lorgio!)
  • SQLite support added. (Thanks, Milan!)
  • Tab completion support for table and column names added to the query editor.
  • A Script Library for managing SQL scripts added (:variables supported).
  • A template system for generating DDL SQL templates.
  • A common toolbar has been added to the Query Editor and Script Library views.
  • A filter bar (CMD+F to focus) to filter and order data with SQL added in the DataBrowser. (Thanks, Lorgio!)
  • The bookmark manager can now remember connection passwords.
  • The execution engine has been completely rebuilt from scratch to better handle multiple queries regardless of type.
  • The database tree now automatically refreshes when DDL is detected.
  • The database tree's state is now recalled when the database is refreshed (expanded nodes remain expanded, selected node remains selected).
  • SQL can now be executed directly from a file without first loading it into the query editor (for larger scripts).
  • It is now possible to drop one more files directly onto the query editor's input area to load sql.
  • Right clicking on a result set now reveals a pop-up menu that allows copying the content of either a single cell or the entire row in CSV format to the clipboard.
  • The bookmark manager now remembers the last selected database type to ease the task of adding bookmarks.
  • Table details are now pre-fetched in a background thread after connection to database is established.
  • A drag handle has been added to the bottom left action bar to make resizing the sidebar easier.
  • PGnJ can now remain running without any windows open (like standard Cocoa applications).
  • Experimental horizontal scroll wheel support added (use preference to toggle).
  • Added preference to convert all zero datetimes in MySQL to NULL (on by default; off causes exception).
  • Added menu items and keyboard shortcuts to navigate the table details at the bottom of the sidebar.
  • A shortcut (CMD+T) to focus on the database tree in the sidebar has been added.
  • A shortcut (CMD+W) to close the preferences window when it is visible has been added.
  • When started, PGnJ now specifically asks if it's okay to check for updates rather than defaulting to autochecking.

Changes:
  • CSV Export no longer wraps integers, floats and booleans in quotes.
  • The connection sheet and bookmark manager are now fully keyboard navigable.
  • The connection sheet now cancels on escape. (Thanks, Manton!)
  • The keyboard shortcut CMD+E and menu item 'Database > Execute SQL' now executes SQL when the QueryEditor is visible and reloads the DataBrowser when the DataBrowser is visible.
  • Altered the row selection behavior on the database tree so that clicking on an expand/collapse arrow doesn't highlight that row unless the currently selected row is a child of that row.
  • When using CMD-UP/CMD-DOWN quick history from the Query Editor, if there is SQL currently in the Editor, it is added to the history so that it isn't lost.
  • The history browser (CMD-SHIFT-H) no longer automatically executes a SQL statement after selecting it and appropriately cleans up the query editor before loading the selected SQL.
  • Connection sheets are now correctly document modal. (Thanks to Werner, the Quaqua developer!)
  • Menu items are now properly enabled or disabled based on the context of the application.
  • Where necessary, tooltips are assigned to disabled menu items to explain how they can be enabled.
  • All tables are now borderless to be more in line with current trends in OS X application design.
  • The background color of the sidebar has been darkened slightly to better resemble the sidebar background colors of other OS X applications.
  • Polished dialogs with more appropriate copy and icons.
  • The QueryEditor now receives focus upon a successful connection to a bookmark.
  • When resizing the window, the sidebar now only grows the area containing the database tree rather than the table details section at the bottom.
  • Updated Quaqua LAF to version 5.0.1. (Thanks to Werner, the Quaqua developer!)

Fixes:
  • Now able to issue ALTER, CREATE and DROP statements to MySQL databases.
  • When a new bookmark is setup to connect to, it is now only added if the connection is successful.
  • The AutoCheckForUpdates preference is no longer (accidently) ignored.
  • Style changes in the query editor are no longer registered in the undo/redo history.
  • When loading a sql file, the QueryEditor properly replaces the current view.
  • Dialogs (sheets) now correctly gain focus, enabling keyboard interaction. (Thanks to Werner, the Quaqua developer!)
  • Columns of a table no longer sporadically appear multiple times in the table details area.

item.author: tsmango@gmail.com
item.description:
Changes in 0.8

Additions:
  • Added automatic Software Update System.
  • Added preference system and Preferences window.
  • Added length of varchar to default view in column inspector. (Thanks, Lorgio!)
  • Added ability to only execute certain SQL in Query Editor by simply highlighting what to execute. (Thanks, Daniel!)
  • Added preference to automatically select the last connected bookmark when the connection sheet is opened (on by default).
  • Added preference to automatically re-sizing columns to fit data (on by default - which is what PGnJ has done since version 0.5).
  • Added preference to display <null> in results table when value is NULL in database (on by default).
  • Added preference to remember window size and position (off by default).
  • Added a real About box (Choose 'About PGnJ' from the Application menu).

Changes:
  • Brought back keyboard focus support. Cycle from database tree to query editor to results table or database tree to right side to database tree with cmd-tab.
  • Removed Java 5 specific language syntax to bring back support for versions of OS X lower than 10.4.
  • Default window positions are now placed 100 pixels higher than dead center. About and Preference windows are 200 pixles above dead center.
  • Replaced round aqua buttons on connection and bookmark manager sheets with placard style buttons.

Fixes:
  • Updated Quaqua LAF to version 3.9.1 to help fix a crash when attempting to make a new database connection.
  • Corrected the behavior when left or right clicking on the database tree. (Thanks, Lorgio!)
  • Corrected spelling of the word 'default' when showing more column details. (Thanks, H. Lally Singh!)
  • Corrected a focus issue when starting the application which caused a slight UI blemish.
  • Corrected various UI blemishes by restricting what components are focusable.
  • Ensured that cells in the column detail tables remain uneditable.
  • Removed inactive 'Find' from edit menu.
  • Removed inactive 'Hide Table Inspector' from view menu.
